title: Outdoor Leash 2 & Focus Games
summary: Polish outdoor leash skills and keep engagement lively in real-world spaces.

lessons.title: Park Loose-Leash Layers
lessons.objective: Maintain a relaxed leash while walking past mild park distractions.
steps: 1. Warm up with 3 slow circles in a quiet corner while praising soft leash.
2. Walk parallel to distractions (benches, joggers at distance) and reward every few loose steps.
3. Add gentle figure-eights near pathways, reinforcing whenever puppy checks in.
4. Finish with a calm sniff break as a bonus for staying connected.
supportGuidelines: Use a treat every step if leash tension creeps back in.
Shift farther from distractions before trying again after pulling.
lessons.safetyNotes: Scan for bikes and keep leash short near pathways.

lessons.title: Outdoor Focus Ping-Pong
lessons.objective: Build rapid name-response and eye contact despite moving stimuli.
steps: 1. Stand still, say puppy’s name once, and mark/reward any head turn.
2. Toss a treat left, cue name again as puppy finishes, reward when eyes meet yours.
3. Repeat to the right, gradually adding mild park motion in the background.
4. Mix in short sits between tosses to keep the routine predictable.
supportGuidelines: Lower tossing distance if puppy can’t reorient quickly.
Count to two before repeating the cue to avoid nagging.
lessons.safetyNotes: Keep long line untangled and away from other park users.

lessons.title: Focus-Then-Move Game
lessons.objective: Teach puppy to offer eye contact before earning forward motion on leash.
steps: 1. Stop walking, plant feet, and wait silently for puppy to glance up.
2. Mark the eye contact and take 3–5 smooth steps forward as the reward.
3. Reset whenever leash tightens, backing up two steps before offering another chance.
4. End with a cheerful release cue so the puppy knows the session is complete.
supportGuidelines: Shorten duration if the puppy’s focus fades; quality beats length.
Add treats back in temporarily if motion reward isn’t enough.
lessons.safetyNotes: Avoid hot pavement; pause often for water breaks.
